result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Jose Moreno Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing. Bond set 9-26-2022.

Case called at 1:34 PM. Defendant Carlos Jose Moreno Hernandez not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter St John appeared. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Unknown why defendant does not appear. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Carlos Jose Moreno Hernandez not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. SPD needs 2 weeks to appoint.  State would like on call at the end of the week.  SPD has been in contact with defendant.  Defendant to appear in person at next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Carlos Jose Moreno Hernandez in court with the assistance of Spanish Interpreter Saul Arteaga.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:12 p.m. Appearance made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Court goes over charges and penalties with the defendant, right to attorney, and provides information as to SPD office. Matter set out before assigned Judge so defendant can see if he qualifies - Assigned to Judge Johnson
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: to Person Posting Bond - Originally filed on 09/26/2022

Defendant Carlos Jose Moreno Hernandez not in court. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
